dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 510 IH: Regulatory Cooling Off Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Hageman introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide for a 6 month delay before a final rule may take effect.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Regulatory Cooling Off Act of 2025.

section.header: Delay in effective date of rules
section.text: Title 5, United States Code, is amended as follows:

subparagraph.text: in subsection (c), by inserting , for a period of not less than 60 days, before interested persons;
in subsection (d), by striking 30 days and inserting 6 months; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The agency shall submit a finalized rule to Congress for referral to each committee of jurisdiction in each House of Congress not later than 6 months prior to the effective date of the rule.
The agency shall publish notice in the Federal Register on the date that a finalized rule takes effect.

The agency shall post on the website of such agency a final rule or proposed rule not less than 24 hours before such final rule or proposed rule is published in the Federal Register pursuant to this section.

paragraph.text: In section 702, by adding at the end the following: An action under this section may be brought before the district court where the plaintiff resides or before any court for a district where the agency has an office..

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)(1)(A), by inserting after shall submit to each House of the Congress the following: not later than the date that is 6 months prior to the effective date of such rule; and
in subsection (a)(3), by striking 60 days and inserting 6 months (unless the Congress enacts a joint resolution or other measure explicitly approving the rule).
